passage: Kazuo Ishiguro, born in Nagasaki, Japan, in 1954, moved to England with his family when he was five years old. Although he grew up with a strong connection to both Japanese and British cultures, he is primarily known as a British writer. His novels blend various genres, such as science fiction and historical fiction, and often explore themes of memory, loss, and self-deception. In 2017, Ishiguro was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature, recognizing his exceptional contributions to the world of fiction.
